dt: {bc}having a {a_link|throat} especially of a specified kind
{bc}making a specified kind of sound from the throat

dt.t: … the deep-{wi}throated{/wi} growls and barks of a determined German shepherd.

shortdef: having a throat especially of a specified kind —usually used in combination
making a specified kind of sound from the throat —usually used in combination

dt: {bc}to sing or enunciate in a {a_link|throaty} voice

shortdef: to utter in the throat : mutter
to sing or enunciate in a throaty voice

dt: {bc}produced or expressed with the full power of the voice {bc}loud and powerful

dt.t: Her supple voice can effortlessly move from an insinuating whisper to a {wi}full-throated{/wi} roar to a clear, piping soprano …
Early each morning we were assembled for drill, marching to the cadence of a {wi}full-throated{/wi} Marine sergeant who had little use for us.

dt: {bc}expressed with or characterized by unreserved enthusiasm or conviction

dt.t: a {wi}full-throated{/wi} defense/endorsement of the government's policies

When Elizabeth George's first novel, {ldquo}A Great Deliverance,{rdquo} appeared early last year, it was greeted with the sort of {wi}full-throated{/wi} acclaim that very few mystery debuts … manage to elicit from the American press.
… [George] Gilder, whose 1984 book, {it}The Spirit of Enterprise{/it}, ranks as the twentieth century's most {wi}full-throated{/wi} celebration of entrepreneurship.

utxt.t: Everyone deplores violence, but some more {wi}full-throatedly{/wi} than others.

shortdef: produced or expressed with the full power of the voice : loud and powerful
having a loud and powerful voice
expressed with or characterized by unreserved enthusiasm or conviction

dt: {bc}a hummingbird ({it}Archilochus colubris{/it}) of eastern North America having a bright metallic green back, whitish underparts, and in the adult male a red throat

shortdef: a hummingbird (Archilochus colubris) of eastern North America having a bright metallic green back, whitish underparts, and in the adult male a red throat

dt: {bc}a common brown sparrow ({it}Zonotrichia albicollis{/it}) chiefly of eastern North America with a black-and-white striped crown and a white patch on the throat

shortdef: a common brown sparrow (Zonotrichia albicollis) chiefly of eastern North America with a black-and-white striped crown and a white patch on the throat
